   11363           0 :     ScopedMessage::~ScopedMessage() {
   11364           0 :         if ( !uncaught_exceptions() && !m_moved ){
   11365           0 :             getResultCapture().popScopedMessage(m_info);
   11366             :         }
   11367           0 :     }
   11368             : 
   11369           0 :     Capturer::Capturer( StringRef macroName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, ResultWas::OfType resultType, StringRef names ) {
   11370           0 :         auto trimmed = [&] (size_t start, size_t end) {
   11371           0 :             while (names[start] == ',' || isspace(names[start])) {
   11372           0 :                 ++start;
   11373             :             }
   11374           0 :             while (names[end] == ',' || isspace(names[end])) {
   11375           0 :                 --end;
   11376             :             }
   11377           0 :             return names.substr(start, end - start + 1);
   11378           0 :         };
   11379           0 :         auto skipq = [&] (size_t start, char quote) {
   11380           0 :             for (auto i = start + 1; i < names.size() ; ++i) {
   11381           0 :                 if (names[i] == quote)
   11382           0 :                     return i;
   11383           0 :                 if (names[i] == '\\')
   11384           0 :                     ++i;
   11385             :             }
   11386           0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("CAPTURE parsing encountered unmatched quote");
   11387           0 :         };
   11388             : 
   11389           0 :         size_t start = 0;
   11390           0 :         std::stack<char> openings;
   11391           0 :         for (size_t pos = 0; pos < names.size(); ++pos) {
   11392           0 :             char c = names[pos];
   11393           0 :             switch (c) {
   11394           0 :             case '[':
   11395             :             case '{':
   11396             :             case '(':
   11397             :             // It is basically impossible to disambiguate between
   11398             :             // comparison and start of template args in this context
   11399             : //            case '<':
   11400           0 :                 openings.push(c);
   11401           0 :                 break;
   11402           0 :             case ']':
   11403             :             case '}':
   11404             :             case ')':
   11405             : //           case '>':
   11406           0 :                 openings.pop();
   11407           0 :                 break;
   11408           0 :             case '"':
   11409             :             case '\'':
   11410           0 :                 pos = skipq(pos, c);
   11411           0 :                 break;
   11412           0 :             case ',':
   11413           0 :                 if (start != pos && openings.size() == 0) {
   11414           0 :                     m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11415           0 :                     m_messages.back().message = trimmed(start, pos);
   11416           0 :                     m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11417           0 :                     start = pos;
   11418             :                 }
   11419             :             }
   11420             :         }
   11421           0 :         assert(openings.size() == 0 && "Mismatched openings");
   11422           0 :         m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11423           0 :         m_messages.back().message = trimmed(start, names.size() - 1);
   11424           0 :         m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11425           0 :     }
   11426           0 :     Capturer::~Capturer() {
   11427           0 :         if ( !uncaught_exceptions() ){
   11428           0 :             assert( m_captured == m_messages.size() );
   11429           0 :             for( size_t i = 0; i < m_captured; ++i  )
   11430           0 :                 m_resultCapture.popScopedMessage( m_messages[i] );
   11431             :         }
   11432           0 :     }
   11433             : 
   11434           0 :     void Capturer::captureValue( size_t index, std::string const& value ) {
   11435           0 :         assert( index < m_messages.size() );
   11436           0 :         m_messages[index].message += value;
   11437           0 :         m_resultCapture.pushScopedMessage( m_messages[index] );
   11438           0 :         m_captured++;
   11439           0 :     }

   11472             : 
   11473             :     // StdErr has two constituent streams in C++, std::cerr and std::clog
   11474             :     // This means that we need to redirect 2 streams into 1 to keep proper
   11475             :     // order of writes
   11476           0 :     class RedirectedStdErr {
   11477             :         ReusableStringStream m_rss;
   11478             :         RedirectedStream m_cerr;
   11479             :         RedirectedStream m_clog;
   11480             :     public:
   11481             :         RedirectedStdErr();

   11483             :     };

   11501             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE)
   11502             : 
   11503             :     // Windows's implementation of std::tmpfile is terrible (it tries
   11504             :     // to create a file inside system folder, thus requiring elevated
   11505             :     // privileges for the binary), so we have to use tmpnam(_s) and
   11506             :     // create the file ourselves there.
   11507             :     class TempFile {
   11508             :     public:
   11509             :         TempFile(TempFile const&) = delete;
   11510             :         TempFile& operator=(TempFile const&) = delete;
   11511             :         TempFile(TempFile&&) = delete;
   11512             :         TempFile& operator=(TempFile&&) = delete;
   11513             : 
   11514             :         TempFile();
   11515             :         ~TempFile();
   11516             : 
   11517             :         std::FILE* getFile();
   11518             :         std::string getContents();
   11519             : 
   11520             :     private:
   11521             :         std::FILE* m_file = nullptr;
   11522             :     #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   11523             :         char m_buffer[L_tmpnam] = { 0 };
   11524             :     #endif
   11525             :     };
   11526             : 
   11527             :     class OutputRedirect {
   11528             :     public:

   11533             :

   11605             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
   11606             :         if (tmpnam_s(m_buffer)) {
   11607             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not get a temp filename");
   11608             :         }
   11609             :         if (fopen_s(&m_file, m_buffer, "w")) {
   11610             :             char buffer[100];
   11611             :             if (strerror_s(buffer, errno)) {
   11612             :                 CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not translate errno to a string");
   11613             :             }
   11614             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not open the temp file: '" << m_buffer << "' because: " << buffer);
   11615             :         }
   11616             :     }
   11617             : #else
   11618             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
   11619             :         m_file = std::tmpfile();
   11620             :         if (!m_file) {
   11621             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not create a temp file.");
   11622             :         }
   11623             :     }
   11624             : 
   11625             : #endif
   11626             : 
   11627             :     TempFile::~TempFile() {
   11628             :          // TBD: What to do about errors here?
   11629             :          std::fclose(m_file);
   11630             :          // We manually create the file on Windows only, on Linux
   11631             :          // it will be autodeleted
   11632             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   11633             :          std::remove(m_buffer);
   11634             : #endif
   11635             :     }

   11642             :         std::stringstream sstr;

   11644             :         std::rewind(m_file);
   11645             :         while (std::fgets(buffer, sizeof(buffer), m_file)) {
   11646             :             sstr << buffer;
   11647             :         }
   11648             :         return sstr.str();

   11650             : 
   11651             :     OutputRedirect::OutputRedirect(std::string& stdout_dest, std::string& stderr_dest) :
   11652             :         m_originalStdout(dup(1)),
   11653             :         m_originalStderr(dup(2)),
   11654             :         m_stdoutDest(stdout_dest),
   11655             :         m_stderrDest(stderr_dest) {
   11656             :         dup2(fileno(m_stdoutFile.getFile()), 1);
   11657             :         dup2(fileno(m_stderrFile.getFile()), 2);
   11658             :     }
   11659             : 
   11660             :     OutputRedirect::~OutputRedirect() {
   11661             :         Catch::cout() << std::flush;
   11662             :         fflush(stdout);
   11663             :         // Since we support overriding these streams, we flush cerr
   11664             :         // even though std::cerr is unbuffered
   11665             :         Catch::cerr() << std::flush;
   11666             :         Catch::clog() << std::flush;
   11667             :         fflush(stderr);
   11668             : 
   11669             :         dup2(m_originalStdout, 1);
   11670             :         dup2(m_originalStderr, 2);
   11671             : 
   11672             :         m_stdoutDest += m_stdoutFile.getContents();
   11673             :         m_stderrDest += m_stderrFile.getContents();
   11674             :     }
   11675             :

   11758           1 :     class TestRegistry : public ITestCaseRegistry {
   11759             :     public:
   11760           1 :         virtual ~TestRegistry() = default;
   11761             :

   12182           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = true;

   12378           8 :                 timer.start();
   12379           8 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   12380             :             }

   12386             :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.

   12681             :             // On older platforms, returning std::unique_ptr<ListeningReporter>
   12682             :             // when the return type is std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>
   12683             :             // doesn't compile without a std::move call. However, this causes
   12684             :             // a warning on newer platforms. Thus, we have to work around
   12685             :             // it a bit and downcast the pointer manually.
   12686           0 :             auto ret = std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>(new ListeningReporter);

   12688           0 :             auto const& listeners = Catch::getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getListeners();

   12690           0 :                 multi.addListener(listener->create(Catch::ReporterConfig(config)));

   12696           1 :         class TestGroup {
   12697             :         public:
   12698           1 :             explicit TestGroup(std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config)
   12699           1 :             : m_config{config}

   12704             :

   12706           2 :                     for (auto const& test : allTestCases)
   12707           1 :                         if (!test.isHidden())
   12708           1 :                             m_tests.emplace(&test);
   12709             :                 } else {
   12710           0 :                     for (auto const& match : m_matches)
   12711           0 :                         m_tests.insert(match.tests.begin(), match.tests.end());

   12714             : 
   12715           1 :             Totals execute() {
   12716           1 :                 Totals totals;

   12719           1 :                     if (!m_context.aborting())

   12721             :                     else
   12722           0 :                         m_context.reporter().skipTest(*testCase);
   12723             :                 }
   12724             : 
   12725           1 :                 for (auto const& match : m_matches) {
   12726           0 :                     if (match.tests.empty()) {
   12727           0 :                         m_context.reporter().noMatchingTestCases(match.name);
   12728           0 :                         totals.error = -1;
   12729             :                     }
   12730             :                 }
   12731           1 :                 m_context.testGroupEnded(m_config->name(), totals, 1, 1);

   12733             :             }

   12744           0 :         void applyFilenamesAsTags(Catch::IConfig const& config) {
   12745           0 :             auto& tests = const_cast<std::vector<TestCase>&>(getAllTestCasesSorted(config));

   12752           0 :                     filename.erase(0, lastSlash);

   12754             :                 }

   12758           0 :                     filename.erase(lastDot);
   12759             :                 }

   12768           1 :     Session::Session() {
   12769             :         static bool alreadyInstantiated = false;
   12770           1 :         if( alreadyInstantiated ) {
   12771           0 :             CATCH_TRY { CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Only one instance of Catch::Session can ever be used" ); }
   12772           0 :             CATCH_CATCH_ALL { getMutableRegistryHub().registerStartupException(); }
   12773             :         }
   12774             : 
   12775             :         // There cannot be exceptions at startup in no-exception mode.
   12776             : #if !defined(CATCH_CONFIG_DISABLE_EXCEPTIONS)
   12777           1 :         const auto& exceptions = getRegistryHub().getStartupExceptionRegistry().getExceptions();
   12778           1 :         if ( !exceptions.empty() ) {
   12779           0 :             config();
   12780           0 :             getCurrentMutableContext().setConfig(m_config);
   12781             : 
   12782           0 :             m_startupExceptions = true;
   12783           0 :             Colour colourGuard( Colour::Red );
   12784           0 :             Catch::cerr() << "Errors occurred during startup!" << '\n';
   12785             :             // iterate over all exceptions and notify user
   12786           0 :             for ( const auto& ex_ptr : exceptions ) {
   12787             :                 try {
   12788           0 :                     std::rethrow_exception(ex_ptr);
   12789           0 :                 } catch ( std::exception const& ex ) {
   12790           0 :                     Catch::cerr() << Column( ex.what() ).indent(2) << '\n';
   12791             :                 }
   12792             :             }
   12793             :         }
   12794             : #endif
   12795             :

   13203           0 :         return start != std::string::npos ? str.substr( start, 1+end-start ) : std::string();

   13207           0 :         bool replaced = false;
   13208           0 :         std::size_t i = str.find( replaceThis );
   13209           0 :         while( i != std::string::npos ) {
   13210           0 :             replaced = true;
   13211           0 :             str = str.substr( 0, i ) + withThis + str.substr( i+replaceThis.size() );

   13213           0 :                 i = str.find( replaceThis, i+withThis.size() );

   13215           0 :                 i = std::string::npos;
   13216             :         }
   13217           0 :         return replaced;
   13218             :     }

   13292           0 :     auto StringRef::isOwned() const noexcept -> bool {

   13296           0 :         return m_start[m_size] != '\0';

   13299           0 :     void StringRef::takeOwnership() {
   13300           0 :         if( !isOwned() ) {
   13301           0 :             m_data = new char[m_size+1];
   13302           0 :             memcpy( m_data, m_start, m_size );
   13303           0 :             m_data[m_size] = '\0';
   13304             :         }
   13305           0 :     }

   13308           0 :             return StringRef( m_start+start, size );
   13309             :         else

   13314           0 :             size() == other.size() &&
   13315           0 :             (std::strncmp( m_start, other.m_start, size() ) == 0);

   13325           0 :     auto StringRef::numberOfCharacters() const noexcept -> size_type {
   13326           0 :         size_type noChars = m_size;
   13327             :         // Make adjustments for uft encodings
   13328           0 :         for( size_type i=0; i < m_size; ++i ) {
   13329           0 :             char c = m_start[i];
   13330           0 :             if( ( c & byte_2_lead ) == byte_2_lead ) {
   13331           0 :                 noChars--;
   13332           0 :                 if (( c & byte_3_lead ) == byte_3_lead )
   13333           0 :                     noChars--;
   13334           0 :                 if( ( c & byte_4_lead ) == byte_4_lead )
   13335           0 :                     noChars--;
   13336             :             }
   13337             :         }
   13338           0 :         return noChars;
   13339             :     }

   13448           0 :         TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties parseSpecialTag( std::string const& tag ) {
   13449           0 :             if( startsWith( tag, '.' ) ||
   13450           0 :                 tag == "!hide" )
   13451           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::IsHidden;
   13452           0 :             else if( tag == "!throws" )
   13453           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::Throws;
   13454           0 :             else if( tag == "!shouldfail" )
   13455           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::ShouldFail;
   13456           0 :             else if( tag == "!mayfail" )
   13457           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::MayFail;
   13458           0 :             else if( tag == "!nonportable" )
   13459           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
   13460           0 :             else if( tag == "!benchmark" )
   13461           0 :                 return static_cast<TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties>( TestCaseInfo::Benchmark | TestCaseInfo::IsHidden );
   13462             :             else
   13463           0 :                 return TestCaseInfo::None;
   13464             :         }
   13465           0 :         bool isReservedTag( std::string const& tag ) {
   13466           0 :             return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( static_cast<unsigned char>(tag[0]) );
   13467             :         }

   13469           0 :             CATCH_ENFORCE( !isReservedTag(tag),

   13471             :                           << "Tag names starting with non alphanumeric characters are reserved\n"
   13472             :                           << _lineInfo );

   13479             :                             SourceLineInfo const& _lineInfo )
   13480             :     {
   13481           1 :         bool isHidden = false;
   13482             : 
   13483             :         // Parse out tags
   13484           2 :         std::vector<std::string> tags;
   13485           2 :         std::string desc, tag;
   13486           1 :         bool inTag = false;
   13487           2 :         std::string _descOrTags = nameAndTags.tags;
   13488           1 :         for (char c : _descOrTags) {
   13489           0 :             if( !inTag ) {
   13490           0 :                 if( c == '[' )
   13491           0 :                     inTag = true;
   13492             :                 else
   13493           0 :                     desc += c;
   13494             :             }
   13495             :             else {
   13496           0 :                 if( c == ']' ) {
   13497           0 :                     TestCaseInfo::SpecialProperties prop = parseSpecialTag( tag );

   13499           0 :                         isHidden = true;
   13500           0 :                     else if( prop == TestCaseInfo::None )
   13501           0 :                         enforceNotReservedTag( tag, _lineInfo );

   13503             :                     // Merged hide tags like `[.approvals]` should be added as
   13504             :                     // `[.][approvals]`. The `[.]` is added at later point, so
   13505             :                     // we only strip the prefix
   13506           0 :                     if (startsWith(tag, '.') && tag.size() > 1) {
   13507           0 :                         tag.erase(0, 1);
   13508             :                     }
   13509           0 :                     tags.push_back( tag );
   13510           0 :                     tag.clear();
   13511           0 :                     inTag = false;
   13512             :                 }
   13513             :                 else
   13514           0 :                     tag += c;
   13515             :             }
   13516             :         }
   13517           1 :         if( isHidden ) {
   13518           0 :             tags.push_back( "." );
   13519             :         }

   13618             :

   13620             :

   13622           0 :             case RunTests::InLexicographicalOrder:
   13623           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end() );
   13624           0 :                 break;
   13625           0 :             case RunTests::InRandomOrder:
   13626           0 :                 seedRng( config );
   13627           0 :                 std::shuffle( sorted.begin(), sorted.end(), rng() );
   13628           0 :                 break;
   13629           1 :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
   13630             :                 // already in declaration order
   13631           1 :                 break;
   13632             :         }
   13633           1 :         return sorted;
   13634             :     }

   13662             :             }
   13663             :         }

   13665             :     }

   14082           0 :     void TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {
   14083           0 :         if( c == ',' ) {
   14084           0 :             endMode();
   14085           0 :             addFilter();

   14087             :         }
   14088             :

   14090           0 :         case None:
   14091           0 :             if( processNoneChar( c ) )
   14092           0 :                 return;
   14093           0 :             break;
   14094           0 :         case Name:
   14095           0 :             processNameChar( c );
   14096           0 :             break;
   14097           0 :         case EscapedName:
   14098           0 :             endMode();
   14099           0 :             break;
   14100           0 :         default:
   14101             :         case Tag:
   14102             :         case QuotedName:

   14104           0 :                 return;
   14105           0 :             break;
   14106             :         }
   14107             :

   14109           0 :         if( !isControlChar( c ) )

   14111             :     }
   14112             :     // Two of the processing methods return true to signal the caller to return
   14113             :     // without adding the given character to the current pattern strings
   14114           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processNoneChar( char c ) {
   14115           0 :         switch( c ) {
   14116           0 :         case ' ':
   14117           0 :             return true;

   14119           0 :             m_exclusion = true;
   14120           0 :             return false;
   14121           0 :         case '[':
   14122           0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
   14123           0 :             return false;
   14124           0 :         case '"':
   14125           0 :             startNewMode( QuotedName );
   14126           0 :             return false;

   14128           0 :             escape();
   14129           0 :             return true;
   14130           0 :         default:
   14131           0 :             startNewMode( Name );
   14132           0 :             return false;
   14133             :         }
   14134             :     }
   14135           0 :     void TestSpecParser::processNameChar( char c ) {

   14139             :             else
   14140           0 :                 endMode();

   14142             :         }
   14143           0 :     }

   14210          88 :     auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
   14211          88 :         return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch() ).count();
   14212             :     }
   14213             : 
   14214             :     namespace {
   14215           0 :         auto estimateClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14216           0 :             uint64_t sum = 0;
   14217             :             static const uint64_t iterations = 1000000;
   14218             : 
   14219           0 :             auto startTime = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14220             : 
   14221           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < iterations; ++i ) {
   14222             : 
   14223             :                 uint64_t ticks;
   14224           0 :                 uint64_t baseTicks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14225           0 :                 do {
   14226           0 :                     ticks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14227           0 :                 } while( ticks == baseTicks );
   14228             : 
   14229           0 :                 auto delta = ticks - baseTicks;
   14230           0 :                 sum += delta;
   14231             : 
   14232             :                 // If we have been calibrating for over 3 seconds -- the clock
   14233             :                 // is terrible and we should move on.
   14234             :                 // TBD: How to signal that the measured resolution is probably wrong?
   14235           0 :                 if (ticks > startTime + 3 * nanosecondsInSecond) {
   14236           0 :                     return sum / ( i + 1u );
   14237             :                 }
   14238             :             }
   14239             : 
   14240             :             // We're just taking the mean, here. To do better we could take the std. dev and exclude outliers
   14241             :             // - and potentially do more iterations if there's a high variance.
   14242           0 :             return sum/iterations;
   14243             :         }
   14244             :     }
   14245           0 :     auto getEstimatedClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14246           0 :         static auto s_resolution = estimateClockResolution();
   14247           0 :         return s_resolution;
   14248             :     }
   14249             : 
   14250          72 :     void Timer::start() {
   14251          72 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14252          72 :     }
   14253          16 :     auto Timer::getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14254          16 :         return getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() - m_nanoseconds;
   14255             :     }
   14256          16 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14257          16 :         return getElapsedNanoseconds()/1000;
   14258             :     }
   14259           0 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int {
   14260           0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
   14261             :     }
   14262          16 :     auto Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const -> double {
   14263          16 :         return getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000000.0;
   14264             :     }
   14265             :

   14290             :     namespace {
   14291             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
   14292             : 
   14293             :         struct Endianness {
   14294             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
   14295             : 
   14296           0 :             static Arch which() {
   14297             :                 union _{
   14298             :                     int asInt;
   14299             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
   14300             :                 } u;
   14301             : 
   14302           0 :                 u.asInt = 1;
   14303           0 :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
   14304             :             }
   14305             :         };
   14306             :     }
   14307             : 
   14308           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
   14309             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
   14310           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
   14311           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
   14312           0 :             i = end-1;
   14313           0 :             end = inc = -1;
   14314             :         }
   14315             : 
   14316           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
   14317           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   14318           0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
   14319           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
   14320           0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
   14321           0 :        return rss.str();
   14322             :     }
   14323             : }
   14324             : 
   14325             : template<typename T>
   14326           0 : std::string fpToString( T value, int precision ) {
   14327           0 :     if (Catch::isnan(value)) {
   14328           0 :         return "nan";
   14329             :     }
   14330             : 
   14331           0 :     ReusableStringStream rss;
   14332           0 :     rss << std::setprecision( precision )
   14333           0 :         << std::fixed
   14334             :         << value;
   14335           0 :     std::string d = rss.str();
   14336           0 :     std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of( '0' );
   14337           0 :     if( i != std::string::npos && i != d.size()-1 ) {
   14338           0 :         if( d[i] == '.' )
   14339           0 :             i++;
   14340           0 :         d = d.substr( 0, i+1 );
   14341             :     }
   14342           0 :     return d;
   14343             : }
   14344             :

   14635           0 :     WildcardPattern::WildcardPattern( std::string const& pattern,
   14636           0 :                                       CaseSensitive::Choice caseSensitivity )
   14637             :     :   m_caseSensitivity( caseSensitivity ),
   14638           0 :         m_pattern( adjustCase( pattern ) )
   14639             :     {
   14640           0 :         if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   14641           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
   14642           0 :             m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;
   14643             :         }
   14644           0 :         if( endsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   14645           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );
   14646           0 :             m_wildcard = static_cast<WildcardPosition>( m_wildcard | WildcardAtEnd );
   14647             :         }
   14648           0 :     }
   14649             : 
   14650           0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
   14651           0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
   14652           0 :             case NoWildcard:
   14653           0 :                 return m_pattern == adjustCase( str );
   14654           0 :             case WildcardAtStart:
   14655           0 :                 return endsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   14656           0 :             case WildcardAtEnd:
   14657           0 :                 return startsWith( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   14658           0 :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
   14659           0 :                 return contains( adjustCase( str ), m_pattern );
   14660           0 :             default:
   14661           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
   14662             :         }
   14663             :     }
   14664             : 
   14665           0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::adjustCase( std::string const& str ) const {
   14666           0 :         return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str;
   14667             :     }
   14668             : }

   14672             : #include <iomanip>
   14673             : 
   14674             : using uchar = unsigned char;
   14675             : 
   14676             : namespace Catch {
   14677             : 
   14678             : namespace {
   14679             : 
   14680           0 :     size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
   14681           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   14682           0 :             return 2;
   14683             :         }
   14684           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   14685           0 :             return 3;
   14686             :         }
   14687           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   14688           0 :             return 4;
   14689             :         }
   14690           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   14691             :     }
   14692             : 
   14693           0 :     uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
   14694           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   14695           0 :             return c & 0x1F;
   14696             :         }
   14697           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   14698           0 :             return c & 0x0F;
   14699             :         }
   14700           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   14701           0 :             return c & 0x07;
   14702             :         }
   14703           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   14704             :     }
   14705             : 
   14706           0 :     void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
   14707           0 :         std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
   14708           0 :         os << "\\x"
   14709           0 :             << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
   14710           0 :             << static_cast<int>(c);
   14711           0 :         os.flags(f);
   14712           0 :     }
   14713             : 
   14714             : } // anonymous namespace
   14715             : 
   14716           0 :     XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
   14717             :     :   m_str( str ),
   14718           0 :         m_forWhat( forWhat )
   14719           0 :     {}
   14720             : 
   14721           0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
   14722             :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
   14723             :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
   14724             : 
   14725           0 :         for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
   14726           0 :             uchar c = m_str[idx];
   14727           0 :             switch (c) {
   14728           0 :             case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
   14729           0 :             case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
   14730             : 
   14731           0 :             case '>':
   14732             :                 // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
   14733           0 :                 if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
   14734           0 :                     os << "&gt;";
   14735             :                 else
   14736           0 :                     os << c;
   14737           0 :                 break;
   14738             : 
   14739           0 :             case '\"':
   14740           0 :                 if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
   14741           0 :                     os << "&quot;";
   14742             :                 else
   14743           0 :                     os << c;
   14744           0 :                 break;
   14745             : 
   14746           0 :             default:
   14747             :                 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
   14748             : 
   14749             :                 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
   14750             :                 // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
   14751           0 :                 if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
   14752           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   14753           0 :                     break;
   14754             :                 }
   14755             : 
   14756             :                 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
   14757           0 :                 if (c < 0x7F) {
   14758           0 :                     os << c;
   14759           0 :                     break;
   14760             :                 }
   14761             : 
   14762             :                 // UTF-8 territory
   14763             :                 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
   14764             :                 // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
   14765             :                 // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
   14766             :                 // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
   14767             :                 // Or as 10XX XXXX
   14768           0 :                 if (c <  0xC0 ||
   14769             :                     c >= 0xF8) {
   14770           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   14771           0 :                     break;
   14772             :                 }
   14773             : 
   14774           0 :                 auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
   14775             :                 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
   14776           0 :                 if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
   14777           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   14778           0 :                     break;
   14779             :                 }
   14780             :                 // The header is valid, check data
   14781             :                 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
   14782             :                 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
   14783           0 :                 bool valid = true;
   14784           0 :                 uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
   14785           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   14786           0 :                     uchar nc = m_str[idx + n];
   14787           0 :                     valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
   14788           0 :                     value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
   14789             :                 }
   14790             : 
   14791           0 :                 if (
   14792             :                     // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
   14793           0 :                     (!valid) ||
   14794             :                     // Overlong encodings
   14795           0 :                     (value < 0x80) ||
   14796           0 :                     (0x80 <= value && value < 0x800   && encBytes > 2) ||
   14797           0 :                     (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
   14798             :                     // Encoded value out of range
   14799             :                     (value >= 0x110000)
   14800             :                     ) {
   14801           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   14802           0 :                     break;
   14803             :                 }
   14804             : 
   14805             :                 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
   14806           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   14807           0 :                     os << m_str[idx + n];
   14808             :                 }
   14809           0 :                 idx += encBytes - 1;
   14810           0 :                 break;
   14811             :             }
   14812             :         }
   14813           0 :     }
   14814             : 
   14815           0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
   14816           0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
   14817           0 :         return os;
   14818             :     }
   14819             : 
   14820           0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement::ScopedElement( XmlWriter* writer )

   14828           0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement& XmlWriter::ScopedElement::operator=( ScopedElement&& other ) noexcept {

   14830           0 :             m_writer->endElement();
   14831             :         }

   14851             : 
   14852           0 :     XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
   14853           0 :         while( !m_tags.empty() )
   14854           0 :             endElement();
   14855           0 :     }
   14856             : 
   14857           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name ) {
   14858           0 :         ensureTagClosed();
   14859           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   14860           0 :         m_os << m_indent << '<' << name;
   14861           0 :         m_tags.push_back( name );
   14862           0 :         m_indent += "  ";
   14863           0 :         m_tagIsOpen = true;
   14864           0 :         return *this;
   14865             :     }
   14866             : 
   14867           0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name ) {
   14868           0 :         ScopedElement scoped( this );
   14869           0 :         startElement( name );
   14870           0 :         return scoped;
   14871             :     }
   14872             : 
   14873           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement() {
   14874           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   14875           0 :         m_indent = m_indent.substr( 0, m_indent.size()-2 );
   14876           0 :         if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   14877           0 :             m_os << "/>";
   14878           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   14879             :         }
   14880             :         else {
   14881           0 :             m_os << m_indent << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
   14882             :         }
   14883           0 :         m_os << std::endl;
   14884           0 :         m_tags.pop_back();
   14885           0 :         return *this;
   14886             :     }
   14887             : 
   14888           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
   14889           0 :         if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
   14890           0 :             m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
   14891           0 :         return *this;

   14893             : 
   14894           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
   14895           0 :         m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
   14896           0 :         return *this;
   14897             :     }
   14898             : 
   14899           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, bool indent ) {
   14900           0 :         if( !text.empty() ){
   14901           0 :             bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
   14902           0 :             ensureTagClosed();

   14904           0 :                 m_os << m_indent;
   14905           0 :             m_os << XmlEncode( text );
   14906           0 :             m_needsNewline = true;
   14907             :         }
   14908           0 :         return *this;
   14909             :     }
   14910             : 
   14911           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeComment( std::string const& text ) {
   14912           0 :         ensureTagClosed();

   14914           0 :         m_needsNewline = true;

   14939           0 :     void XmlWriter::newlineIfNecessary() {

   14942           0 :             m_needsNewline = false;

   14960             :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   14961             :     // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   14962           0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   14963             :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   14964             :         // + 1 for decimal point
   14965             :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   14966             :         // + 1 for null terminator
   14967           0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   14968             :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   14969             : 
   14970             :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   14971           0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   14972             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   14973             :         sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   14974             : #else
   14975           0 :         std::sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   14976             : #endif
   14977           0 :         return std::string(buffer);
   14978             :     }
   14979             : 
   14980           0 :     std::string serializeFilters( std::vector<std::string> const& container ) {
   14981           0 :         ReusableStringStream oss;
   14982           0 :         bool first = true;
   14983           0 :         for (auto&& filter : container)
   14984             :         {
   14985           0 :             if (!first)
   14986           0 :                 oss << ' ';
   14987             :             else
   14988           0 :                 first = false;
   14989             : 
   14990           0 :             oss << filter;
   14991             :         }
   14992           0 :         return oss.str();
   14993             :     }

   15022             :     // Colour::LightGrey
   15023           0 :     Catch::Colour::Code dimColour() { return Catch::Colour::FileName; }
   15024             : 
   15025           0 :     std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) {
   15026             :         return count == 1 ? std::string() :
   15027           0 :                count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   15028             :     }
   15029             :

   15031             : 
   15032             : namespace Catch {
   15033             : namespace {
   15034             : // Colour, message variants:
   15035             : // - white: No tests ran.
   15036             : // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   15037             : // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   15038             : // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   15039             : // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   15040           0 : void printTotals(std::ostream& out, const Totals& totals) {
   15041           0 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   15042           0 :         out << "No tests ran.";
   15043           0 :     } else if (totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total()) {
   15044           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15045             :         const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   15046           0 :             totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   15047           0 :             bothOrAll(totals.assertions.failed) : std::string();
   15048             :         out <<
   15049           0 :             "Failed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.failed)
   15050           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15051           0 :             "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   15052           0 :             pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15053           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() == 0) {
   15054             :         out <<
   15055           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.total())
   15056           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.total(), "test case")
   15057           0 :             << " (no assertions).";
   15058           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.failed) {
   15059           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15060             :         out <<
   15061           0 :             "Failed " << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15062           0 :             "failed " << pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15063             :     } else {
   15064           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultSuccess);
   15065             :         out <<
   15066           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.passed)
   15067           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") <<
   15068           0 :             " with " << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << '.';
   15069             :     }
   15070           0 : }
   15071             : 
   15072             : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
   15073           0 : class AssertionPrinter {
   15074             : public:
   15075             :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15076             :     AssertionPrinter(AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15077           0 :     AssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   15078           0 :         : stream(_stream)
   15079             :         , result(_stats.assertionResult)
   15080             :         , messages(_stats.infoMessages)
   15081           0 :         , itMessage(_stats.infoMessages.begin())
   15082           0 :         , printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {}
   15083             : 
   15084           0 :     void print() {
   15085           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   15086             : 
   15087           0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
   15088             : 
   15089           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   15090           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   15091           0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString());
   15092           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15093           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15094           0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
   15095           0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15096             :             else
   15097           0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
   15098           0 :             break;
   15099           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   15100           0 :             if (result.isOk())
   15101           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string(" - but was ok"));
   15102             :             else
   15103           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15104           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15105           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15106           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15107           0 :             break;
   15108           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   15109           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15110           0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
   15111           0 :             printMessage();
   15112           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15113           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15114           0 :             break;
   15115           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   15116           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15117           0 :             printIssue("fatal error condition with message:");
   15118           0 :             printMessage();
   15119           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15120           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15121           0 :             break;
   15122           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   15123           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15124           0 :             printIssue("expected exception, got none");
   15125           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15126           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15127           0 :             break;
   15128           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   15129           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info");
   15130           0 :             printMessage();
   15131           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15132           0 :             break;
   15133           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   15134           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "warning");
   15135           0 :             printMessage();
   15136           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15137           0 :             break;
   15138           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   15139           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15140           0 :             printIssue("explicitly");
   15141           0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15142           0 :             break;
   15143             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   15144           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   15145             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   15146             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   15147           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");
   15148           0 :             break;
   15149             :         }
   15150           0 :     }
   15151             : 
   15152             : private:
   15153           0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {
   15154           0 :         Colour colourGuard(Colour::FileName);
   15155           0 :         stream << result.getSourceInfo() << ':';
   15156           0 :     }
   15157             : 
   15158           0 :     void printResultType(Colour::Code colour, std::string const& passOrFail) const {
   15159           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   15160             :             {
   15161           0 :                 Colour colourGuard(colour);
   15162           0 :                 stream << ' ' << passOrFail;
   15163             :             }
   15164           0 :             stream << ':';
   15165             :         }
   15166           0 :     }
   15167             : 
   15168           0 :     void printIssue(std::string const& issue) const {
   15169           0 :         stream << ' ' << issue;
   15170           0 :     }
   15171             : 
   15172           0 :     void printExpressionWas() {
   15173           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15174           0 :             stream << ';';
   15175             :             {
   15176           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   15177           0 :                 stream << " expression was:";
   15178             :             }
   15179           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15180             :         }
   15181           0 :     }
   15182             : 
   15183           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   15184           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15185           0 :             stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();
   15186             :         }
   15187           0 :     }
   15188             : 
   15189           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   15190           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   15191             :             {
   15192           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   15193           0 :                 stream << " for: ";
   15194             :             }
   15195           0 :             stream << result.getExpandedExpression();
   15196             :         }
   15197           0 :     }
   15198             : 
   15199           0 :     void printMessage() {
   15200           0 :         if (itMessage != messages.end()) {
   15201           0 :             stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   15202           0 :             ++itMessage;
   15203             :         }
   15204           0 :     }
   15205             : 
   15206           0 :     void printRemainingMessages(Colour::Code colour = dimColour()) {
   15207           0 :         if (itMessage == messages.end())
   15208           0 :             return;
   15209             : 
   15210           0 :         const auto itEnd = messages.cend();
   15211           0 :         const auto N = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(itMessage, itEnd));
   15212             : 
   15213             :         {
   15214           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   15215           0 :             stream << " with " << pluralise(N, "message") << ':';
   15216             :         }
   15217             : 
   15218           0 :         while (itMessage != itEnd) {
   15219             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   15220           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info) {
   15221           0 :                 printMessage();
   15222           0 :                 if (itMessage != itEnd) {
   15223           0 :                     Colour colourGuard(dimColour());
   15224           0 :                     stream << " and";
   15225             :                 }
   15226           0 :                 continue;
   15227             :             }
   15228           0 :             ++itMessage;
   15229             :         }
   15230             :     }
   15231             : 
   15232             : private:
   15233             :     std::ostream& stream;
   15234             :     AssertionResult const& result;
   15235             :     std::vector<MessageInfo> messages;
   15236             :     std::vector<MessageInfo>::const_iterator itMessage;
   15237             :     bool printInfoMessages;
   15238             : };
   15239             :

   15241             :

   15256           0 :         bool CompactReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& _assertionStats ) {
   15257           0 :             AssertionResult const& result = _assertionStats.assertionResult;
   15258             : 
   15259           0 :             bool printInfoMessages = true;
   15260             : 
   15261             :             // Drop out if result was successful and we're not printing those
   15262           0 :             if( !m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() && result.isOk() ) {
   15263           0 :                 if( result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   15264           0 :                     return false;
   15265           0 :                 printInfoMessages = false;
   15266             :             }
   15267             : 
   15268           0 :             AssertionPrinter printer( stream, _assertionStats, printInfoMessages );
   15269           0 :             printer.print();
   15270             : 
   15271           0 :             stream << std::endl;
   15272           0 :             return true;
   15273             :         }
   15274             : 
   15275           0 :         void CompactReporter::sectionEnded(SectionStats const& _sectionStats) {

   15277           0 :                 stream << getFormattedDuration(_sectionStats.durationInSeconds) << " s: " << _sectionStats.sectionInfo.name << std::endl;

   15314             : // Formatter impl for ConsoleReporter
   15315           0 : class ConsoleAssertionPrinter {
   15316             : public:
   15317             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter& operator= (ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15318             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15319           0 :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   15320           0 :         : stream(_stream),
   15321             :         stats(_stats),
   15322             :         result(_stats.assertionResult),
   15323             :         colour(Colour::None),
   15324           0 :         message(result.getMessage()),
   15325             :         messages(_stats.infoMessages),
   15326           0 :         printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {
   15327           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   15328           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   15329           0 :             colour = Colour::Success;
   15330           0 :             passOrFail = "PASSED";
   15331             :             //if( result.hasMessage() )
   15332           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15333           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   15334           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15335           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   15336           0 :             break;
   15337           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   15338           0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
   15339           0 :                 colour = Colour::Success;
   15340           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
   15341             :             } else {
   15342           0 :                 colour = Colour::Error;
   15343           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15344             :             }
   15345           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15346           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   15347           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15348           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   15349           0 :             break;
   15350           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   15351           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15352           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15353           0 :             messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with ";
   15354           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15355           0 :                 messageLabel += "message";
   15356           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15357           0 :                 messageLabel += "messages";
   15358           0 :             break;
   15359           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   15360           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15361           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15362           0 :             messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
   15363           0 :             break;
   15364           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   15365           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15366           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15367           0 :             messageLabel = "because no exception was thrown where one was expected";
   15368           0 :             break;
   15369           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   15370           0 :             messageLabel = "info";
   15371           0 :             break;
   15372           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   15373           0 :             messageLabel = "warning";
   15374           0 :             break;
   15375           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   15376           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   15377           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15378           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   15379           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with message";
   15380           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   15381           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with messages";
   15382           0 :             break;
   15383             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   15384           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   15385             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   15386             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   15387           0 :             passOrFail = "** internal error **";
   15388           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   15389           0 :             break;
   15390             :         }
   15391           0 :     }
   15392             : 
   15393           0 :     void print() const {

   15475             : class Duration {
   15476             :     enum class Unit {
   15477             :         Auto,
   15478             :         Nanoseconds,
   15479             :         Microseconds,
   15480             :         Milliseconds,
   15481             :         Seconds,
   15482             :         Minutes
   15483             :     };
   15484             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
   15485             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
   15486             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
   15487             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
   15488             : 
   15489             :     uint64_t m_inNanoseconds;
   15490             :     Unit m_units;
   15491             : 
   15492             : public:
   15493             :         explicit Duration(double inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   15494             :         : Duration(static_cast<uint64_t>(inNanoseconds), units) {
   15495             :     }
   15496             : 
   15497             :     explicit Duration(uint64_t inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   15498             :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
   15499             :         m_units(units) {
   15500             :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
   15501             :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
   15502             :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
   15503             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
   15504             :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
   15505             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
   15506             :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
   15507             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
   15508             :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
   15509             :             else
   15510             :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
   15511             :         }
   15512             : 
   15513             :     }
   15514             : 
   15515             :     auto value() const -> double {
   15516             :         switch (m_units) {
   15517             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   15518             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
   15519             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   15520             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
   15521             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   15522             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
   15523             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   15524             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
   15525             :         default:
   15526             :             return static_cast<double>(m_inNanoseconds);
   15527             :         }
   15528             :     }
   15529             :     auto unitsAsString() const -> std::string {
   15530             :         switch (m_units) {
   15531             :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
   15532             :             return "ns";
   15533             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   15534             :             return "us";
   15535             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   15536             :             return "ms";
   15537             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   15538             :             return "s";
   15539             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   15540             :             return "m";
   15541             :         default:
   15542             :             return "** internal error **";
   15543             :         }
   15544             : 
   15545             :     }
   15546             :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {
   15547             :         return os << duration.value() << " " << duration.unitsAsString();
   15548             :     }
   15549             : };
   15550             : } // end anon namespace

   15841           0 : struct SummaryColumn {
   15842             : 
   15843           0 :     SummaryColumn( std::string _label, Colour::Code _colour )
   15844           0 :     :   label( std::move( _label ) ),
   15845           0 :         colour( _colour ) {}
   15846           0 :     SummaryColumn addRow( std::size_t count ) {
   15847           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   15848           0 :         rss << count;
   15849           0 :         std::string row = rss.str();
   15850           0 :         for (auto& oldRow : rows) {
   15851           0 :             while (oldRow.size() < row.size())
   15852           0 :                 oldRow = ' ' + oldRow;
   15853           0 :             while (oldRow.size() > row.size())
   15854           0 :                 row = ' ' + row;
   15855             :         }
   15856           0 :         rows.push_back(row);
   15857           0 :         return *this;
   15858             :     }
   15859             : 
   15860             :     std::string label;
   15861             :     Colour::Code colour;

   15866           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   15867           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   15868           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "No tests ran\n";
   15869           1 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed()) {
   15870           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << "All tests passed";
   15871           1 :         stream << " ("
   15872           2 :             << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << " in "
   15873           2 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") << ')'
   15874           1 :             << '\n';
   15875             :     } else {
   15876             : 
   15877           0 :         std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;
   15878           0 :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("", Colour::None)
   15879           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.total())
   15880           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.total()));
   15881           0 :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("passed", Colour::Success)
   15882           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.passed)
   15883           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.passed));
   15884           0 :         columns.push_back(SummaryColumn("failed", Colour::ResultError)
   15885           0 :                           .addRow(totals.testCases.failed)
   15886           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.failed));

   15891           0 :         printSummaryRow("test cases", columns, 0);
   15892           0 :         printSummaryRow("assertions", columns, 1);

   15894           1 : }

   15900           0 :             if (value != "0")

   15904           0 :         } else if (value != "0") {

   15913           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
   15914           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
   15915           1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
   15916           1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
   15917           1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
   15918           1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   15919           0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)++;
   15920           3 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   15921           1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)--;
   15922             : 
   15923           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Error) << std::string(failedRatio, '=');
   15924           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultExpectedFailure) << std::string(failedButOkRatio, '=');
   15925           1 :         if (totals.testCases.allPassed())
   15926           1 :             stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   15927             :         else
   15928           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::Success) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   15929             :     } else {
   15930           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << std::string(CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=');
   15931             :     }
   15932           1 :     stream << '\n';
   15933           1 : }
   15934           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryDivider() {
   15935           0 :     stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';

   15965           0 :         std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
   15966             :             // Beware, this is not reentrant because of backward compatibility issues
   15967             :             // Also, UTC only, again because of backward compatibility (%z is C++11)
   15968             :             time_t rawtime;
   15969           0 :             std::time(&rawtime);
   15970           0 :             auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
   15971             : 
   15972             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   15973             :             std::tm timeInfo = {};
   15974             :             gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
   15975             : #else
   15976             :             std::tm* timeInfo;
   15977           0 :             timeInfo = std::gmtime(&rawtime);
   15978             : #endif
   15979             : 
   15980             :             char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
   15981           0 :             const char * const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
   15982             : 
   15983             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   15984             :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
   15985             : #else
   15986           0 :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, timeInfo);
   15987             : #endif
   15988           0 :             return std::string(timeStamp);
   15989             :         }
   15990             : 
   15991           0 :         std::string fileNameTag(const std::vector<std::string> &tags) {
   15992             :             auto it = std::find_if(begin(tags),
   15993             :                                    end(tags),
   15994           0 :                                    [] (std::string const& tag) {return tag.front() == '#'; });
   15995           0 :             if (it != tags.end())
   15996           0 :                 return it->substr(1);
   15997           0 :             return std::string();
   15998             :         }

   16056           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeGroup( TestGroupNode const& groupNode, double suiteTime ) {

   16094           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {

   16116           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeSection(  std::string const& className,

   16128           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname", name );
   16129           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "name", "root" );
   16130             :             }

   16132           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname", className );
